subject: Leadership
title: Opportunity Cost
description: A short lesson to help you apply Opportunity Cost.

hook.text: A company pursues ten projects at once. All ten deliver mediocre results. A competitor picks two and dominates both.

buildup.text: Opportunity cost is the value of the best alternative you give up when making a choice. Every yes is a no to something.

discovery.text: Buffett: 'The difference between successful and very successful people is that the latter say no to almost everything.'

twist.text: Most leaders track financial costs but ignore opportunity costs. The biggest waste isn't moneyâ€”it's misallocated focus.

climax.text: Before any commitment, ask: what will we not be able to do? If the trade-off isn't worth it, the answer is no.

punchline.text: Strategy is the art of sacrifice. Choose what to give up.

quiz.question: What is opportunity cost?
options: The price of a new opportunity
The value of the best alternative forgone
The cost of starting a new project
